_header: As I could walk because of recreation
Note: For a poem with the same refrain see 2312.
_description: Dialogue between a Clerk and a Husbandman — seven 8-line stanzas with refrain: ‘Turn vp her halter and let her go’

BLAdd38666.First Lines:
As I cowth walke be cause of recreacionAs I kan be a grene wade
                    syde…
BLAdd38666.Last Lines:
…ffor wether þu tell me trouth or noeThou scalte nat make
                    me myse beleue
BLAdd38666.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             “Dialogue between a Clerk and a Husbandman.” 
             Modern Language Notes
         33 (1918): 415-7: 415-17.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 180-1.
